alert.note: Alert for Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 15 at 2:51PM EST until December 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...PROLONGED WINTER STORM EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY... .Low pressure across the Mid Atlantic will move north and east into southern New England tonight and on Friday...with the season`s first widespread winter storm expected to continue across the area through Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM FRIDAY TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible. Snowfall accumulations of 4 to 12 inches are expected with the greatest accumulations at elevations above 1000 feet. * WHERE...Western and Central Hillsborough and Merrimack Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM Friday to 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...A snowstorm will bring plowable snow to the region with a period of moderate travel impacts expected. Periods of moderate snow and low visibility will be the biggest hazards. The snow will be heavy and wet and may caused down tree limbs and scattered power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may mix with rain at times during the day Friday before changing to all snow Friday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
